extends java.lang.Object

this class handles all the input from the touch screen

 void setScreenDevisionRatio(float ratio)
          This Method determines what amount of the left side of the screen is counted as "map input", where 0f equals 0% and 1f equals 100% respectively.
 void setScreenResolution(int screenResolutionX, int screenResolutionY)
          this method sets the screen resolution of the touchscreen it is needed because all the touch inputs are mapped to pixels on the screen, so the touch screen input is depending on knowing the current resolution

Constructor Detail

InputTouch

public InputTouch()
the constructor defines what regions of the screen are used as buttons or as coordinate-maps. Right now this is hard coded, but should be dynamic in the future

Method Detail

setScreenDevisionRatio

public void setScreenDevisionRatio(float ratio)
This Method determines what amount of the left side of the screen is counted as "map input", where 0f equals 0% and 1f equals 100% respectively.

Parameters:
ratio -

setScreenResolution

public void setScreenResolution(int screenResolutionX,
                                int screenResolutionY)
this method sets the screen resolution of the touchscreen it is needed because all the touch inputs are mapped to pixels on the screen, so the touch screen input is depending on knowing the current resolution

Parameters:
screenResolutionX -
screenResolutionY -

onTouch

public boolean onTouch(MotionEvent event)
this method handles all the input touch events

Parameters:
event - the touch event that triggered this method call
Returns:
always true, because it handles everything all the time.

getButtonWasPressed

public boolean getButtonWasPressed(int number)
This method checks whether a button was pressed since the last time it was checked.

Parameters:
number - represents the Nth button.
Returns:
whether the button was pressed during that period
